description: A 268-foot waterfall, located east of Seattle on the Snoqualmie River.
Mount Rainier National Park offers breathtaking hiking trails with stunning views of the majestic Mount Rainier.
The Discovery Park Loop Trail offers a scenic hike through Seattle's largest park, showcasing stunning views of Puget Sound, the Olympic Mountains, and diverse wildlife habitats.
The Cedar River Trail is a beautiful hike along the Cedar River, offering picturesque views of the river, surrounding forests, and opportunities for birdwatching and wildlife spotting.
Evans Creek Preserve is a natural oasis featuring a variety of hiking trails through forests, meadows, and wetlands, providing a peaceful escape and opportunities to observe local flora and fauna.
Soaring Eagle Regional Park offers a network of scenic hiking trails through lush forests and open meadows, providing a peaceful retreat and opportunities for wildlife viewing.

The Wildside Trail - De Leo Wall is a challenging hike that rewards adventurers with stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys, offering a thrilling outdoor experience for seasoned hikers.
Poo Poo Point is a popular hiking destination in the Issaquah Alps, offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys, making it a favorite spot for paragliders and hikers alike.
